alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Ohio (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 8:41PM EDT until April 13 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT FOR OHIO...SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN...EASTERN RIPLEY...DEARBORN... NORTHERN SWITZERLAND AND BOONE COUNTIES... At 841 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Moores Hill, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Brookville, Rising Sun, Bright, Hidden Valley, Milan, Dillsboro, Shawnee, Moores Hill, Guilford, Wilmington, Logan, Pleasant, Manchester, French, Sunman, Hartford and St. Leon. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 153 and 171. I-74 in Ohio near mile marker 0. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
